intro: Pedicularis sherriffii, commonly known as the Sherriff's lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, characterized by its parasitic nature and lack of chlorophyll. The plant produces striking, spurred flowers that range in color from red to purple, often resembling those of orchids. It thrives in high-altitude environments, typically in open meadows and rocky areas. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
